channel.title: Bin Laden dead, USA has body [IMAGES RELEASED NSFW (not osama)]
channel.description:
Osama bin Laden, hunted as the mastermind behind the worst-ever terrorist attack on U.S. soil, has been killed, sources told ABC News. His death brings to an end a tumultuous life that saw bin Laden go from being the carefree son of a Saudi billionaire, to terrorist leader and the most wanted man in the world. Bin Laden created and funded the al Qaeda terror network, which was responsible for the Sept. 11, 2001, attacks on the United States. The Saudi exile had been a man on the run since the U.S.-led invasion of Afghanistan overthrew the ruling Taliban regime, which harbored bin Laden. In a video filmed two months after the Sept. 11 attacks, bin Laden gloated about the attack, saying it had exceeded even his "optimistic" calculations. "Our terrorism is against America. Our terrorism is a blessed terrorism to prevent the unjust person from committing injustice and to stop American support for Israel, which kills our sons," he said in the video. Long before the Sept. 11 attacks, bin Laden was known as an enemy of the United States. He was suspected of playing large roles in the 1998 bombings of two U.S. Embassies in Africa and the attack on the USS Cole in the Yemeni port of Aden in October 2000.
http://abcnews.go.com/Blotter/osama-bin-laden-killed/story?id=13505703 In other news a NATO missile killed Gaddafi's youngest son and 3 grandsons. [img]http://mediacdn.reuters.com/media/global/specials/bin-laden/bin-laden-compound1.jpg[/img] [img]http://mediacdn.reuters.com/media/global/specials/bin-laden/bin-laden-compound2.jpg[/img] [img]http://mediacdn.reuters.com/media/global/specials/bin-laden/bin-laden-compound3.jpg[/img] [img]http://mediacdn.reuters.com/media/global/specials/bin-laden/bin-laden-compound4.jpg[/img] http://www.reuters.com/subjects/bin-laden-compound

item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

[quote=“ytuio9, post:274, topic:393490”][quote author=Frell link=topic=490657.msg3608185#msg3608185 date=1306294847]

There are members of the US army who aren’t terrorists either.

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=B6hp8HMstkE&feature=share

The entire mission isn’t based around incidents like this, thats what people don’t get. They weren’t ordered to go and there and just kill. Im completely against anything like this, and if this is how our soldiers spend their time and are being rewarded “4 days off” for stabbing a man to death then we need to leave. We had a valid reason to go to war, we had a very good chance of actually helping Iraq had we actually did what we were supposed to do and applied ourselves. We could have been out as early as 2005 and had a new strong ally right along side Israel to stand as an example for neighboring countries.

Fuckem

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=b3ZjsC3BOBE&feature=related Loads up more information about what you posted

“As I dragged her out of her home she shouted “You guys are worse than Saddam!””.
[/quote]
Just wondering, but what was the valid reason that made the us go to war?[/quote]

911 weapons of mass destrucTION TERRORISM AAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAA

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Svitkona Svitkona
item.description:
@Svitkona wrote:

I just picked the first list I saw, I’m sure if you tried to look deeper people of middle east origins will tend to be more chaotic. Again I just picked a random list I saw, but to be honest, most middle easterners I know aren’t that calm at all in their mannerisms which is exactly the image people see when they think of a middle easterner.

Even though now that I think about it, it’s just different cultures. From what I’ve seen, middle easterners tend to be loud and most people don’t appreciate that. That’s only one of the qualities I’ve noticed in middle easterners but they do make us stand out.

item.description:
@tL wrote:

I wonder why you Americans automatically assume a terrorist is someone who is likely of middle eastern origin. A terrorist can be anyone, a terrorist could be the white guy with his child.

It isn’t about offending people. Also: Not everyone fighting against the coalition forces in Afghanistan and Iraq are terrorists.

item.title: Bin Laden dead, USA has body [IMAGES RELEASED NSFW (not osama)]
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

They are fighting in a ‘civilian populated area’, so you can’t help but firing inside one. This isn’t the 1700s when stupid Europeans lined up against each other in an open field wearing brightly colored uniforms and took turns firing muskets at each other without aiming. It’s guerilla warfare inside of populated cities filled full of a combination of innocent bystanders and enemy soldiers, all dressed alike. The best that can be done is to try to only kill the bad guys, and I’m sure every American soldier does just that.

Contrast that with the terrorists, who specifically target innocents, and women and children, because it causes the most terror. And they are terrorists. There is obviously nothing in common between the two.

Read full topic

item.title: Bin Laden dead, USA has body [IMAGES RELEASED NSFW (not osama)]
item.dc:creator: @Bebemycat2 Bebe
item.description:
@Bebemycat2 wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:255, topic:393490”][quote author=Speljohan link=topic=490657.msg3606426#msg3606426 date=1306164870]

Never lethal force to make a point, just for self defense, and only then against those that are threatening your life. For example if I felt the government was oppressing me, I wouldn’t go to a public place and kill as many innocent bystanders as I could, that isn’t self defense. On the other hand if the government turned on the people and the people had to defend themselves against government agents, that is another story.

How do you know they don’t feel they’re doing the same thing?

Because they are killing unarmed innocent women and children?
[/quote]Sounds like the invasion of Iraq to me.

I’m sure accidents do happen, but I’m positive no American soldier ever tried to kill women or children, which is exactly who the terrorists are targeting.[/quote]
http://www.presstv.com/detail/180071.html

All I had to do was type “American soldiers killing woman and children” into google and I got a ton of results. That is just the first one I saw…

And yeah “accidents” do happen… but when you’re clearly firing into a civilian populated area than you have no regard for those peoples’ life and you’re just as guilty as the ‘terrorists’.

Read full topic
